meanings.definition: Showing an excessive sentimentality or melodramatic quality.
meanings.sent1: The movie's ending was even cornier than I expected.
meanings.sent2: Her love for romantic comedies made her enjoy the cornier scenes.
meanings.sent3: The soap opera's plot became even cornier when the main character's evil twin appeared.
meanings.sent4: His attempts at being poetic were getting cornier by the minute.
meanings.sent5: The sentimental music made the moment feel even cornier than it already was.

meanings.sent1: The cornier fields were ready for harvest.
meanings.sent2: The farmer's knowledge of cornier crops helped him succeed.
meanings.sent3: The cornier husks were a sign that the corn was ripe.
meanings.sent4: The cornier kernels were plump and golden.
meanings.sent5: The cornier aroma filled the air during the harvest season.

meanings.definition: Having a stale or outdated quality.
meanings.sent1: The fashion from last season looked even cornier this year.
meanings.sent2: The jokes in the old sitcom felt cornier with each passing year.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to revive the cornier trend fell flat.
meanings.sent4: The cornier style of the 80s is making a comeback.
meanings.sent5: The cornier design of the vintage car gave it a unique charm.
